page.title: 09Ecology Deer Pheasants
page.content: The introduction of various species of deer and game birds into the Woburn Estate has led to an interesting change in the local ecology.The Muntjac deer have wandered into the Aspley Guise area and can be a nuisance. "In the winter the deer come into our gardens. They come from the woods and from Woburn Park. They eat Tessa's roses, Emily's bulbs and Mark's berries. David has put a spring on his gate to stop them getting in, but they often jump over the fences. Some of the deer are quite tame and Abigail keeps one as a pet." Class Two. There are colonies of Lady Amherst's Pheasants in the fields around the villages. Many, unfortunately, become road casualties. Others are regarded as pests by the farming community.
